svg.title: Digital Product Passport - Fair Trade Coffee Example
svg.desc: A Digital Product Passport infographic for fair trade coffee showing comprehensive transparency across social, ecological, and economic journeys. The coffee bag is at the center with branching information about worker conditions, environmental impact, and community economic benefits.

This Digital Product Passport demonstrates complete supply chain transparency for fair trade coffee from Coopedota Cooperative in Costa Rica's Tarrazú region. The central coffee bag connects to three main journey categories:
Social Journey (Left Side): - Living wages: $4.20 per pound versus commodity price of $1.80 per pound, representing a 133% premium for farmers - Democratic governance: 800 small-scale farmers with equal voting rights in cooperative decision-making - Gender equity: 35% women cooperative members with equal participation in governance - Education investment: $50,000 annually supporting children's scholarships and adult literacy programs
Ecological Journey (Top): - Biodiversity support: Shade-grown coffee supporting over 200 bird species in forest canopy - Soil health: Composting program sequestering 50 tons of CO2 annually through improved soil management - Water conservation: Processing methods using 50% less water than conventional techniques - Forest protection: 500 acres of forest preserved through fair trade premiums
Economic Journey (Right Side): - Local economic multiplier: 73% of coffee income remains in the local community rather than extracting to distant shareholders - Community investments: $200,000 annually funding community health clinic and school infrastructure - Fair trade premium: Additional $0.20 per pound dedicated specifically to community development projects - Long-term partnerships: 15-year relationship between cooperative and Equal Exchange ensuring stability
Product Identity (Bottom): - Origin and processing details: Bourbon and Caturra arabica varieties, washed method, sun-dried - Quality specifications: Medium roast processed at Equal Exchange facility - Traceability: Complete chain from specific farms through processing to final retail
This passport demonstrates how Digital Product Passports enable consumers to understand the complete social and environmental impact of their purchasing decisions while supporting transparent, regenerative supply chains.
svg.text: Scan QR code or tap NFC for complete transparency

g.aria-label: QR code for accessing complete Digital Product Passport information
Fair trade coffee bag from Coopedota Cooperative, Costa Rica
Connection lines linking coffee bag to social, ecological, and economic data

svg.text: Origin: Coopedota Cooperative, Tarrazú region, Costa Rica
Variety: Bourbon and Caturra arabica • Processing: Washed, sun-dried
Roast: Medium roast • Roasted at: Equal Exchange, West Bridgewater, MA

g.aria-label: Call to action for consumers to use Digital Product Passport information
g.text: Every cup supports living wages, protects 200+ bird species, and keeps wealth in farming communities
Complete impact data updates in real-time • View full audit trail at [website link]
